Description: Coordinates all interventional radiology procedures with optimal utilization of the available resources. Responsible and accountable for the assessment, planning, implementation and evaluation of care of interventional radiology patients. Function as a specialist to provide support and education to medical staff and patients as needed.1.Provides assessment, plan of care and evaluation of interventional radiology and provides follow-up care as necessary.2.Acts as a consultant to the multidisciplinary team during the patient treatment.3.Coordinates and participates in routine patient care review meetings and case conferences as required.4.Coordinates and plans the interventional radiology clinic patient’s treatment plan.5.Evaluates and manages the minor procedure medical problem issues related to interventional radiology procedure patients.6.Performs continuous evaluation of the flow process of the section’s procedures and develops plan to improve it.7.Supports and manages the process of patient referral to the Interventional Radiology Service.8.Liaises with internal and external organizations in the exchange of information, benchmarking and in the coordination of activities related to best practice in clinical specialty.9.Participates in hospital committees as required.Bachelor’s Degree in nursing or equivalent is required.Four (4) years of related experience is required.·Current Registration from country of origin and Saudi Commission for Health Specialties (SCHS) is required.·Patient Procedures Coordination experience is preferred.Job Details
